title: Bank of England says UK inflation has peaked after leaving interest rates on hold at 4% – business live
summary: Bank of England governor Andrew Bailey provided insights on the recent decision to maintain borrowing costs, which resulted in a narrow 5-4 vote among policymakers. He emphasized the need for caution amid ongoing economic uncertainties. The decision reflects a balancing act between supporting growth and addressing inflation concerns.

title: ‘More clowns than Billy Smart’s circus’ - Reform UK under fire as Kent council holds first full meeting since video leak – live
summary: The leader of Reform UK on Kent County Council faced scrutiny over their behavior regarding the Nolan principles, which promote ethical standards in public life. When questioned about their adherence to these principles, they simply replied "yes." This indicates a defense of their conduct amid ongoing challenges.

title: Trump promised lower prices, but Republicans lost as voters sought affordability
summary: Trump's declining popularity is evident, as his disapproval rating has reached an all-time high. This disconnection may have contributed to the outcomes of the recent elections. Observers suggest these results reflect a broader dissatisfaction with his leadership.

title: Bank of England’s decision to keep interest rates at 4% is not all doom and gloom
summary: A tightly contested vote has sparked optimism for a potential interest rate cut in December, as recent data indicates that inflation has peaked at 3.8%. Analysts believe this could provide the Federal Reserve with the opportunity to ease monetary policy. The outcome may lead to a shift in economic strategies as policymakers respond to changing inflation trends.

title: Reform UK suspends another member of Kent county council
summary: Isabella Kemp's resignation has contributed to the party losing nine out of 57 councillors elected in May. This includes four councillors who left following the leak of a video. The ongoing departures raise concerns about the party's stability.
